newsitem.title: USA: Kennametal sees higher Q2 sales.
newsitem.headline: Kennametal sees higher Q2 sales.

text.p: Kennametal Inc said Thursday it expects second quarter sales to improve compared to last year, with sales in the North America metalworking market benefitting from improving U.S. economic conditions.
Sales in the Europe metalworking market, which are principally driven by the German market, are not expected to improve in the next quarter, Kennametal said.
Sales demand in the Asia-Pacific metalworking market are expected to slow, the company said.
Kennametal expects its future sales and earnings to show growth over fiscal 1996.
During the quarter ended September 30, Kennametal earned $15.2 million or $0.57 a share on net sales of $275.2 million, compared to $13.6 million or $0.51 a share on net sales of $254.9 million.
For the September quarter, sales in the North America metalworking market increased 4 percent from the previous year, while Europe metalworking market sales dropped 7 percent during the quarter.
